channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023100151
item.description:
Report E-2023100151

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCH experienced an over the road release of UN3265 DC14 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 15' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 5' area on the concrete roadway due to a drum being tipped over in transit, causing a release from the loose bung cap. Three drums were up righted, wiped down, and secured for shipment on. Lime and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to neutralize and clean the release. All impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Chicago Heights, IL and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023090583
item.description:
Report X-2023090583

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was processed as normal. It was discovered as leaking very lightly from the bottom corner of the box and was then immediately pulled aside and inspected for damage. Upon inspection, 1 of 2 caps were found loose and had resulted in leakage within the box. There was no spillage outside of the package, so no cleanup was necessary. DescribePack: Package failure was a loose lid which was twisted about 1/3 of the way off, which resulted in leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from the load side and inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023090579
item.description:
Report X-2023090579

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET FROM INTERNAL LEAKAGE. CONTENTS INSIDE CONSISTED OF 4 X 1 US GAL PLASTIC BOTTLES THAT FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS. ENTIRE PACKAGE DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE DUE TO LOOSEN BOTTLE CAPS THAT CAUSED SPILLAGE, DAMAGING ALL. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULLATED, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2023100206
item.description:
Report E-2023100206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 50 pound bags of amomum hydrogen difluoride (un1727) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 pound of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
